isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Engine Cranking Test

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine correct engine cranking speed to start the engine. Do the following test if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is unavailable or fails to function correctly. Low battery power or an electronic failure may inhibit the EST from receiving diagnostic data.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

para.emph: Make sure batteries are fully charged before doing this test.

svcsubproc.para: Engine cranking rpm must generate the required ICP to operate the fuel injectors and create enough compression to ignite the fuel.

svcsubproc.title: Measuring Cranking rpm with CMP Breakout Tee

step1.para: Connect Breakout tee (ZTSE4486) between CMP sensor and CMP sensor harness.
Ground black DMM negative probe to the engine.
Set DMM knob to V/ RPM and toggle to RPM or Hz.
Crank engine for 20 seconds (minimum) and measure cranking rpm (Hz) at CMP signal green connector (C)

note.para: When using a DMM in the 4 cycle RPM mode, the meter reading must be divided by 12 to equal the actual rpm of the engine. When reading Hertz (Hz), the meter reading is 1/5 the actual rpm. (26Hz = 130 rpm)

step1.para: Record engine cranking speed on Mechanical Diagnostics form EGED-180-2

svcsubproc.title: Measuring Cranking rpm with Breakout Box

step1.para: Remove upper engine connector (60 pin) from the ECM.
Install breakout box (ZTSE4445) adapter connectors to the engine and chassis female connections on the Electronic Control Module (ECM).
Connect engine harness connector to the breakout box adapter connector.

note.para: Torque connector to ECM to 35 in·lbs (4 N·m).

step1.para: Connect the (+ lead) of the Digital Volt Ohm Meter (DMM) to terminal 51 and the (- lead) to terminal 19. Select the DC voltage scale and press the RPM button.
Crank the engine and check the DMM. A minimum of 130 rpm (26 Hz) is necessary to start the engine.
Record cranking engine rpm on Mechanical Diagnostics form EGED-180-2.
If DMM indicates 0 frequency during engine cranking, the ECM will not receive a signal from the CMP sensor. See CMP sensor diagnostics, in Section 3, Electronic Control System Diagnostics.
If the CMP sensor is not functioning, it must be replaced. The ECM will not allow the Injector Pressure Regulator (IPR) valve to fully activate without a CMP signal.

note.para: If no frequency/engine rpm is measured with the DMM, check for more Diagnostic Trouble Codes. See EST Diagnostic Trouble Codes (Test 5), STI Button - Flash codes (Test 8) , and Camshaft Position (CMP) sensor diagnostics in Section 3, Electronic Control System Diagnostics.

item.para: Low cranking rpm: Starting system electrical malfunctions, incorrect oil grade, or long oil change intervals in cold ambient temperature conditions.
No engine rpm: Poor electrical connection at CMP sensor connector for wiring harness, wiring harness to sensor (open or shorted), or a defective CMP sensor causing 0 frequency / engine rpm.
See CMP sensor diagnostics in Section 3, Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics.
